basics.name: Kaloyan Parvanov
basics.label: AI Engineer
basics.summary: AI Engineer with a strong background in Applied Mathematics, specializing in the design and deployment of end-to-end LLM-powered systems. Proven experience architecting novel solutions for classifying unstructured enterprise data, building sophisticated semantic search and re-ranking engines, and developing scalable tools for data analysis across diverse business contexts.

work.name: Invictus Growth Partners
work.summary: Engineering LLM-powered systems for enterprise data analysis and classification.
highlights: Engineered a novel LLM classification framework to systematically prioritize unstructured data from noisy and incomplete sources.
Built an end-to-end semantic search system using text embeddings and a custom re-ranking algorithm for highly relevant results.
Architected a scalable insights engine, using a flexible LLM classifier to operate across diverse business datasets.

work.name: DataAnnotation & Outlier AI
work.summary: Freelance position enhancing AI models and collaborating with development teams.
highlights: Enhanced AI models by correcting coding and mathematical responses, improving accuracy and reliability.
Identified and rectified hallucinations in AI outputs, contributing to significant error rate reduction.

work.name: University of Colorado Boulder
highlights: Assisted in teaching mathematics courses including Calculus and Differential Equations.
Provided academic support and feedback to students.

education.score: Summa Cum Laude, Phi Beta Kappa

projects.name: MathBuddy: AI-Powered Math Tutor
projects.summary: Full-stack AI tutor utilizing GPT-4o for interactions and GPT-3.5-Turbo for result extraction and difficulty estimation.
highlights: Engineered a full-stack AI tutor utilized by over 200 users, leveraging GPT-4o for interactions and GPT-3.5-Turbo for result extraction and difficulty estimation.
Implemented serverless architecture with Next.js frontend and FastAPI backend, integrating OpenAI and Wolfram Alpha APIs to enhance problem-solving capabilities.

projects.name: Tic-Tac-Toe with Alpha-Beta Pruning
projects.summary: Tic-Tac-Toe game featuring an AI opponent using the Alpha-Beta Pruning Minimax algorithm.
highlights: Developed a Tic-Tac-Toe game featuring an AI opponent using the Alpha-Beta Pruning Minimax algorithm.
Improved AI decision-making speed by 40% by reducing evaluated nodes, enhancing gameplay experience.

projects.name: ODE Solution via PINNs
projects.summary: Solved the damped unforced pendulum problem using Physics-Informed Neural Networks.
highlights: Engineered and trained a Physics-Informed Neural Network (PINN) to accurately model the damped pendulum problem, demonstrating the successful application of a cutting-edge deep learning technique to solve complex ODEs.
